Passage: Minimum capital

Minimum capital requirements
(1)	A Captive Insurer must have and maintain at all times the minimum capital required under this Chapter
(2)	The minimum capital requirement for a Captive Insurer is the highest of the following:
(a)	the base capital requirement for the Captive Insurer under Rule ‎2.2.2;
(b)	the premium risk component under Rule ‎2.2.3; and
(c)	the technical provision risk component under Rule ‎2.2.4 or Rule ‎2.2.5.
(3)	Notwithstanding Rule ‎2.2.1(2) above, the Regulator may, by written notice, direct a Captive Insurer (whether on application of the Captive Insurer or on the Regulator’s own initiative) to comply with a higher minimum capital requirement than as set out in these Rules.
Obligations:
Obligation:1 "Maintain Minimum Capital at All Times:**
   - Ensure that the Captive Insurer maintains the required minimum capital as per the regulatory rules at all times."

Obligation:2 "Determine the Minimum Capital Requirement:**
   - Calculate the minimum capital requirement, which is the highest of:
     a. Base Capital Requirement (Rule 2.2.2)
     b. Premium Risk Component (Rule 2.2.3)
     c. Technical Provision Risk Component (Rule 2.2.4 or Rule 2.2.5)"

Obligation:3 "Compliance with Regulator's Directives:**
   - Comply with any written notices from the Regulator directing a higher minimum capital requirement, whether initiated by the Captive Insurer or the Regulator."

Obligation:4 "Documentation and Evidence:**
   - Maintain accurate records and calculations to demonstrate compliance with the minimum capital requirements and be prepared to provide evidence to the Regulator upon request."

Obligation:5 "Regulatory Reporting:**
   - Report to the Regulator as required, including any changes that may affect the minimum capital requirement."

Obligation:6 "Risk Management:**
   - Implement and maintain a risk management system to ensure capital levels are adequate in relation to the Captive Insurer's risk profile."

Obligation:7 "Notification of Breaches:**
   - Notify the Regulator immediately if the minimum capital requirement is not met at any point."

Obligation:8 "Regular Review:**
   - Regularly review capital adequacy to ensure ongoing compliance, particularly in response to changes in risk profile or business operations."

Obligation:9 "Stay Informed and Communicate:**
   - Keep updated with changes to the regulatory framework and maintain open communication with the Regulator to ensure compliance.

Failure to adhere to these obligations can lead to regulatory actions, including fines or revocation of the license to operate as a Captive Insurer in the ADGM."

Premium risk component
The premium risk component for a Class 1, Class 2, Class 3 or Class 4 Captive Insurer is the amount calculated in accordance with the following formula:
18% x Captive Insurer's Net Written Premium up to $5 million
+
16% x Captive Insurer's Net Written Premium in excess of $5 million
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Calculate Net Written Premium (NWP):** Determine the total premium written minus premiums ceded to reinsurers."

Obligation:2 "Apply Premium Risk Component Formula:**
   - Use an 18% factor for the first $5 million of NWP.
   - Use a 16% factor for any NWP exceeding $5 million."

Obligation:3 "Perform Premium Risk Component Calculation:**
   - Calculate 18% of NWP if $5 million or less.
   - If over $5 million, calculate 18% of the first $5 million and 16% of the remainder."
Obligation:4 "Sum Results (if applicable):** Add the amounts from the above calculations to determine the total premium risk component."
Obligation:5 "Maintain Capital Adequacy:** Ensure capital resources are adequate to cover the premium risk component along with other risk components."
Obligation:6 "Compliance and Reporting:** Adhere to FSRA reporting requirements, including periodic financial statements and capital adequacy reports."
Obligation:7 "Record Keeping:** Maintain accurate records of calculations and supporting data for potential FSRA review."

The total eligible capital of a Captive Insurer is the amount of the Captive Insurer's eligible capital, calculated in accordance with the following formula:
Eligible capital – required deduction
where:
Eligible capital means the sum of the Captive Insurer’s —
(a)	permanent share capital;
(b)	retained earnings or losses;
(c)	the following items up to an amount not exceeding 50% of the sum of paragraphs (a) and (b) above:
(d)	qualifying letters of credit under Rule ‎3.1.4; and
(e)	any other instrument permitted by the Regulator under Rule ‎3.1.2(2)(a).
Required deduction, for a Captive Insurer, means the sum of—
(i)	investments in Subsidiaries and Associates;
(ii)	intangible assets; and
(iii)	any other asset that the Regulator directs, under Rule ‎3.1.2(2)(b), the Captive Insurer to include.
Obligations:
Obligation:1 "Calculate Total Eligible Capital**: 
   - Sum up the components of eligible capital, which include permanent share capital and retained earnings or losses.
   - Include up to 50% of the sum of permanent share capital and retained earnings or losses from qualifying letters of credit and other permitted financial instruments as per Rule 3.1.2(2)(a)."

Obligation:2 "Determine Eligible Capital Components**: 
   - Identify permanent share capital and retained earnings or losses.
   - Assess qualifying letters of credit and other financial instruments for eligibility and compliance with Rule 3.1.2(2)(a)."

Obligation:3 "Identify and Deduct Required Deductions**: 
   - Deduct investments in subsidiaries and associates, intangible assets, and any other assets directed by the Regulator under Rule 3.1.2(2)(b) from the eligible capital."

Obligation:4 "Compliance with Rules**: 
   - Ensure adherence to Rule 3.1.4 regarding qualifying criteria for letters of credit.
   - Follow Rule 3.1.2(2)(a) for other financial instruments that can be considered as eligible capital.

The premium risk component for a Captive Cell carrying out Contracts of Insurance as a Class 1, Class 2, Class 3 or Class 4 Captive Insurer is the amount calculated in accordance with the following formula:

The technical provision risk component for a Captive Cell carrying out Contracts of Insurance as a Class 1, Class 2, Class 3 or Class 4 Captive Insurer that conducts General Insurance Business is the amount calculated in accordance with the following formula:
5% × net claims reserve under general Contracts of Insurance
where net claims reserve, as at a date, is the amount of the Captive Insurer's provisions for:
i.	claims incurred but not yet paid as at the date, including claims incurred but not yet reported; and
ii.	direct and indirect claims settlement expenses for those claims,
less the amount of reinsurance and other recoveries expected to be received in respect of those claims.
Obligations:

   - Apply the provided formula to calculate the technical provision risk component, which is 5% of the net claims reserve."

   - Calculate the net claims reserve by including:
     - Provisions for claims incurred but not yet paid, including IBNR.
     - Provisions for direct and indirect claims settlement expenses."

Obligation:3 "Adjust for Reinsurance and Recoveries**:
   - Deduct the expected amount of reinsurance and other recoveries from the total net claims reserve."

Recognition of reinsurance receivables
A Captive Insurer may only treat an expected receivable under a reinsurance contract in relation to which it is a Cedant as an asset or take account of it for the purposes of calculating its liabilities under Contracts of Insurance it has effected if the contractual arrangements and the transfer of risk are legally effective and enforceable in all relevant jurisdictions and either the relevant reinsurer is solvent or the Captive Insurer has the benefit of legally effective collateral having a value equal to or greater than the amount of the expected receivable.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Legal Effectiveness and Enforceability**: Ensure that all reinsurance contracts and risk transfers are legally effective and enforceable in all jurisdictions involved."
Obligation:2 "Reinsurer Solvency Assessment**: Assess and confirm the financial stability and solvency of the reinsurer to ensure they can meet their obligations."

Obligation:3 "Collateral Requirements**: Obtain and maintain legally effective collateral equal to or greater than the amount of the expected receivable if there are any doubts about the reinsurer's solvency."
Obligation:4 "Valuation of Collateral**: Regularly revalue the collateral to ensure its market value is equal to or exceeds the amount of the expected receivable."

Obligation:5 "Asset Recognition**: Recognize an expected receivable under a reinsurance contract as an asset only if the conditions of legal enforceability, reinsurer solvency, and collateral requirements are met."

Obligation:6 "Liability Calculation**: Take into account an expected receivable from a reinsurance contract when calculating liabilities under Contracts of Insurance only if the aforementioned conditions are satisfied."

Obligation:7 "Compliance and Documentation**: Maintain comprehensive documentation to support the enforceability of reinsurance contracts, the solvency of reinsurers, and the valuation of collateral."

Obligation:8 "Regulatory Reporting**: Report the status of reinsurance receivables and related collateral in regular filings with the ADGM Financial Services Regulatory Authority (FSRA).

By adhering to these action items, Captive Insurers within ADGM will ensure that their financial statements accurately reflect their financial position and comply with the regulatory framework, thereby avoiding potential regulatory actions or penalties."

The amount referred to in Rule ‎10.3.2(1)(b) is calculated as follows:
(a)	in the case of a Captive Cell of a Captive Insurer which is a Cell Company, the sum of the following two amounts:
(i)	the Insurance Liabilities attributable to that Captive Cell; and
(ii)	the Minimum Cellular Capital Requirement applicable to that Captive Cell.
(b)	in the case of a Long-Term Insurance Fund, subject to Rules ‎10.3.2(4)(c) and ‎10.3.2(4)(d), the sum of the following two amounts:
(i)	the Insurance Liabilities attributable to that Long-Term Insurance Fund; and
(ii)	the Minimum Fund Capital Requirement applicable to that Long-Term Insurance Fund;
(c)	in the case of a Captive Insurer that is not a Cell Company, the sum of the following two amounts:
(i)	the Captive Insurer's Insurance Liabilities; and
(ii)	the Captive Insurer's minimum capital requirement as provided for in Rule 2.2.
(d)	in the case of a Captive Insurer to which Rules ‎10.3.2(4)(a) and ‎10.3.2(4)(c) both apply, the amount set out in ‎10.3.2(4)(a); and
(e)	in the case of a Captive Insurer to which Rules ‎10.3.2(4)(c) and ‎10.3.2(4)(d) both apply, the amount set out in Rule ‎10.3.2(4)(d).
Obligations:
Obligation:1 "For Captive Cells of a Captive Insurer (Cell Company):**
   - Ensure capital meets or exceeds the sum of the Insurance Liabilities and the Minimum Cellular Capital Requirement for the Captive Cell.
   - Accurately calculate the capital required under Rule 10.3.2(1)(b)."

Obligation:2 "For Long-Term Insurance Funds:**
   - Ensure capital meets or exceeds the sum of the Insurance Liabilities and the Minimum Fund Capital Requirement for the Long-Term Insurance Fund.
   - Take into account the specific provisions under Rules 10.3.2(4)(c) and 10.3.2(4)(d).
   - Accurately calculate the capital required under Rule 10.3.2(1)(b), considering the aforementioned provisions."

Obligation:3 "For Captive Insurers (Non-Cell Company):**
   - Ensure capital meets or exceeds the sum of the Captive Insurer's Insurance Liabilities and the Captive Insurer's minimum capital requirement as per Rule 2.2.
   - Accurately calculate the capital required under Rule 10.3.2(1)(b)."

Obligation:4 "For Captive Insurers subject to both Rules 10.3.2(4)(a) and 10.3.2(4)(c):**
   - Comply with the capital amount set out in Rule 10.3.2(4)(a)."

Obligation:5 "For Captive Insurers subject to both Rules 10.3.2(4)(c) and 10.3.2(4)(d):**
   - Comply with the capital amount set out in Rule 10.3.2(4)(d).

**General Obligations for All Cases:**
- Maintain capital at or above the required minimums.
- Comply with all relevant rules, regulations, reporting requirements, risk management policies, and prudential standards set by the ADGM financial regulatory authority.
- Review the full text of the rules and consult with a compliance expert or legal advisor to ensure full compliance with regulatory obligations.
- Stay updated with any amendments to the rules and consult with the ADGM Financial Services Regulatory Authority (FSRA) or a compliance professional for any uncertainties."

A Captive Insurer to which this Rule applies must inform the Regulator in writing of the existence and principal features of any contract which it enters into in respect of its Insurance Business in run-off, including Insurance Business carried on through a Captive Cell or a Long-Term Insurance Fund that is in run-off, or that is in existence at the time the Captive Insurer places that Insurance Business into run-off, and that is of any of the following types:
(a)	contracts, other than Contracts of Insurance effected by the Captive Insurer prior to going into run-off, with parties that are Related to the Captive Insurer;
(b)	contracts relating to the management of the Insurance Business in run-off, and any other contracts with the same counterparty or parties Related to that counterparty; or
(c)	contracts for reinsurance of the Insurance Business that is in run-off, and any other contracts with the same counterparty or parties Related to that counterparty.
Obligations:
Obligation:1 "Notify the Regulator**:
   - Inform the FSRA in writing about the existence and principal features of non-insurance contracts related to the Insurance Business in run-off, including those with related parties, management contracts, and reinsurance contracts."

Obligation:2 "Disclose Specific Contracts**:
   - Disclose contracts with related parties that are not Contracts of Insurance effected prior to run-off.
   - Disclose contracts related to the management of the Insurance Business in run-off, including those with the same or related counterparties.
   - Disclose reinsurance contracts for the Insurance Business in run-off, including any other contracts with the same or related reinsurance counterparties."

Obligation:3 "Provide Detailed Information**:
   - Include principal features such as the nature of the contract, parties involved, terms and conditions, duration, financial obligations or entitlements, and other significant provisions."

Obligation:4 "Timely Disclosure**:
   - Make disclosures when entering into any specified contracts during the run-off period or if such contracts exist at the time the Insurance Business is placed into run-off."

Obligation:5 "Maintain Ongoing Compliance**:
   - Continuously review and promptly report any new contracts or changes to existing contracts within the specified categories to the Regulator."

Obligation:6 "Record-Keeping**:
   - Keep accurate and complete records of all disclosed contracts and communications with the Regulator."

Obligation:7 "Consult with Professionals**:
   - Seek clarification from the Regulator or consult with a compliance professional or legal counsel to ensure compliance with all regulatory requirements.

By following these action items, the Captive Insurer can ensure compliance with the ADGM regulatory obligations for the disclosure of certain contracts related to Insurance Business in run-off."
